headline: Newmont (NEM): Revisiting Valuation After a 150% One-Year Total Shareholder Return
summary: Newmont (NEM) has quietly turned into one of the market’s stronger comeback stories, with the stock up about 16% year to date and roughly 26% over the past 3 months. See our latest analysis for Newmont. That strength is not just a dead cat bounce. The 30 day share price return of 13.54% and 90 day gain of 26.16% suggest momentum is clearly building, while the 1 year total shareholder return above 150% shows how quickly sentiment around Newmont’s earnings power and gold exposure has flipped...

headline: Gold Miners’ Stocks Are Outrunning Gold. It Won’t Last.
summary: FEATURE  Gold miners’ stocks have had a great run. But investors who embrace this risky way to bet on the price of gold might get burned. It’s been a great year for gold, with the precious metal’s price gaining more than 60%—thanks to geopolitical uncertainty, a weakening dollar, and global central banks’ purchases.

headline: Will Falling Gold Production Weigh on Newmont's Q4 Performance?
summary: NEM's gold output slid again in Q3, and Q4 is set to mirror the weakness as asset sales and lower grades pressure production.

headline: Aris Mining's Expenses are on the Rise: Will It Affect Margins?
summary: ARMN's Q3 2025 AISC climbs as Segovia costs rose, but stronger gold prices and higher sales volumes help margins stay resilient.
